alert.note: Alert for Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 10:02PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Isolated strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Northampton, Middlesex, Isle of Wight, southeastern Northumberland, Sussex, southeastern Charles City, central Prince George, southeastern New Kent, Mathews, Lancaster, eastern Greensville, Southampton, York, James City, Gloucester, southeastern King and Queen, and Surry Counties, the City of Poquoson, the City of Newport News, the City of Franklin, the City of Suffolk, the City of Norfolk, the western City of Chesapeake, the City of Hampton, the City of Emporia, the City of Portsmouth and the City of Williamsburg through 1115 PM EST... At 1000 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking showers and isolated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Church View to near Gaston. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts to 30 to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Urbanna, Church View and Saluda around 1005 PM EST. Lancaster and Claresville around 1015 PM EST. Kilmarnock and White Stone around 1020 PM EST. Boykins around 1035 PM EST. Newsoms around 1040 PM EST. Franklin and Tangier around 1055 PM EST. Holland around 1110 PM EST. Whaleyville around 1115 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these storms include Pons, Carrollton, Gum Forks, Laban, Camp Peary, Oriana, Huntersville, Brook Vale, Lumberton and Dory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
